I missed it the first time around, but Saigon Nites has boba tea!  That alone is worth giving it an additional star in my book!    We enjoyed Zack's birthday dinner at Saigon Nites last night and I had the Shrimp Pho this time - it was fantastic!  I cannot get enough of Saigon Nites!

Very nice family owned restaurant. They are always polite and friendly. They remember regular customers and make a point to come over and say hello.   They prepare and serve authentic Vietnamese food and everything on the menu is delicious. I recommend the Pho over anything but honestly, you can't go wrong.  The prices are right. The place is always clean. It is a great place!   It is tucked away in a random shopping center, but trust me, it is worth the trip!

First off, this would have been a pretty decent 4 stars if service was a little more considerate.. The food was good- don't get me wrong. It was authentically flavored. I got the fried tofu saut√©ed with lemongrass and other spices. And it was pretty good. My friend got the shaken beef (b√≤ l√∫c lc) and he loved it (and he's a pretty picky eater). So I'd say food was pretty successful, but for me, I've definitely had better, since I grew up in Vietnam and was used to more authentic dishes.  I was really bummed that they didn't have any rice crepe (b√°nh x√®o) when I came in today, even though it was dinner time. Maybe they ran out? Who knows, but rice crepe is a solid and beloved dish and should never have a shortage lol The 1 criticism I have about service is that the waiter seemed really rushed about getting our order.. he approached 3-4x asking even after we requested time to look over the menu. Maybe that was just inexperience. He also gave us our check half-way thru the meal. No joke. Brought us the check while I was gnawing thru half of my tofu dish and said thank you for coming. Idk I felt like I was constantly rushed to order and to eat and to leave. But maybe that's just me.

The shrimp wonton soup is amazing. The broth is delicious and flavorful, the shrimp stuffed wontons are incredible and the shrimp are plump. Last time I ordered it with chicken. I was not a fan of the chicken. For my taste (and please keep in mind, I'm very particular about meat textures), I think it's cut "wrong" and affects the texture (makes it a bit tougher), so I'll pass on that ingredient. Other than that, I have NO complaints, I'll definitely be back many times.
I  love the Pho but everything else on the menu is average. I highly recommend adding the bean sprouts and jalape√±o to the soup really makes it satisfying and filling.
The food was great! Just the wait staff struggle from time to time. So just be patient and you will enjoy. I highly recommend the Seafood Pho!

I really wanted to like this place. It had decent Yelp reviews and the employees were Vietnamese. The waiters were surly just as I hoped so I thought it would be authentic.   The food was expensive, bland, and questionable. I ordered beef curry and I'm positive they tried passing off pork as beef. The curry broth was water and lacked spice or depth.   I also ordered stir fried pho i.e. chow fun, but when it came out it was more like stir fried bean sprouts. The dish was 40% bean sprouts and 60% noodles. The shrimp was overcooked and extremely tough.  If you're White and still call Asian food Oriental you might enjoy this place.
The pho is good as expected except being small. nice and clean! The spring rolls is very nice

This a great place to come and get pho. Sadly, we won't be coming back to this place anymore nor will we recommend this restaurant to anyone. It's not about the food or the staff we had an issue with, it with their manager/owner. She was Absolutely rude!!! She actually yelled and scream at me in front of my children!! We are frequent guest there, we noticed that our bill already had the gratuity added on there without getting notified. All I did was asking when did they enforce this rule and why isn't it not listed on their menu or anywhere in their restaurant. Rather than explaining it to me, she proceeds by yelling and screaming about we are so rude not wanting to give gratuity!! It was a simple question no need for the hostility. She scared my children. Then she chased us out her restaurant!  I feel like I'm being pranked and someone is coming out to say gotcha!

Worst Phad Thai I've ever had in my entire life! My husband and I always order Phad Thai in Pei Wei. But, we decided to try this Saigon Nites for a change. Since its close to his work. Guess what? I got an upset stomach after eating this food. It has an awful taste and very watery. They shouldn't mixed the beans sprout on the noodles. Because yeah... It will produce water as soon as you mixed it in your hot dish. This should be on top! They even put an orange food coloring and I don't understand why??? The noodles are very saggy, mushy including veggies. As if I'm eating throw-up or baby food. Also the shrimp has a fishy taste and not even deveined. I'm a shrimp lover and I know the taste of a fresh shrimp or not. It's a waste of money. Very disappointed.

I've been here twice now and I'm just not that impressed with the flavor of the food here. And it seems a bit pricey for what you get.  Will give the place another try as there are not that many Vietnamese restaurants in this part of the town.

Very good food, had the chicken pho, tasted clean & flavorful, portion is big, can be shared, although would've been helpful if they had split it themselves. Also had the chicken Vietnamese salad, delicious, as well as the shaken beef. Would come again

Best Pho in the valley!!! Literally eat here 4 times a week on average. Steak and Meatball Pho for the win. My girlfriend is Japanese and very very particular with her Asian cuisines. Obviously, in America, some of the true Asian flavors can be jeopardized. This particular Vietnamese family is always on point and owns a memorable lunch spot. Thank you, always, Saigon Nites! Stay consistent!

Let's see:  I've been here two days in a row and I really really like it!!   Pho with brisket is super yummy AND the eggrolls are delicious!  The broth is just the way I like it:  mild and not too pungent because I like to add the hot & hoisin sauce to my liking.  It's a perfect lunch especially on a cold rainy day.        What a treat to have Saigon Nites in north Scottsdale.  It's truly a gem hidden in one of the most obscure centers, the food is good, and the service is excellent.  They took a chance to offer exotic cuisine in NoSco and I hope people try it out b/c it was pretty much empty when I was there both times.  I highly recommend it!!
The best pho I have ever tasted in my life. IT IS EPIC and I eat pho everywhere. Nothi,g compares to this place.  It is outrageous how good the broth is. And it is affordable!!

Not as good as we hoped. Maybe we just didn't order the right things. It was lunch, so I had the papaya salad. I know... probably not even Vietnamese, but it was just OK. Hubby's pho was also just OK.   We'd be willing to try it again. Next time, hopefully a more adventurous menu selection will also be more exciting.

We came in a group of 17 from Cali & they were able to service us!  This place can be as good as what we serve in Southern Cali!   We had pho in various types (highly recommend the special), pork chop rice,  banh xeo & Bo luc lac (beef stir fry), everything was very good!   Surely be back when we visit again!  The place is next to Valero Gas station so can be easily spotted!

My wife, daughter and myself had a really enjoyable meal here at Saigon Nites. My initial yen was for the Pho... but we all decided to share a few of the other entrees... and we went for the Beef Stew and a noodle dish.  But dishes were really, really good! The stew was very "brothy" (more like a soup)... but the abundant beef was falling apart tender.   The prices are really reasonable.  We will be back!

Simply delicious! I love the noodle soup (Pho). I like the side plate the comes out with sprouts, fresh mint, and a lime wedge.  The place is operated by a hard working family and each dish I have there reminds me I made a good choice coming in.   The chairs are hard, and since I lost 40lbs. following a hospitalization, I really need a cushion. Perhaps I'd go with five stars if I was a little more comfortable.

I was a little skeptical about this place, especially after my wide range of Pho experiences, but Saigon Nites does Pho, and they do it WELL.  The first few minutes were a little awkward...was I expected to wait for the waitress or seat myself?  I opted to wait politely, but I found others boldly walking in and seating themselves.  Despite this little mishap, the service is great. My food came out quickly and the waitstaff stopped by a couple times during the meal.   Spring rolls and hot tea are necessary components of the Pho experience.  The jasmine tea was flavorful without a hint of bitterness.  The shrimp spring rolls were a hit; I loved the ratio of rice noodles, greens (basil and lettuce) and shrimp--not too many noodles and plenty of the good stuff.  The peanut sauce was perfection.   Better bring an appetite--the portions are gigantic!  I was promptly presented with a steaming bowl of chicken pho and I tossed in the heaping plate of bean sprouts and basil.  I'm not a fan of raw sprouts, but they come to life upon meeting the piping hot broth.  The broth had good flavor and body without being excessively oily or salty.   If you're not feeling Pho, there are plenty of Chinese items--lemon chicken, sesame chicken, beef and broccoli, chow mien, egg rolls....The list goes on and on.   All around a tasty, reasonably priced establishment.

Located off Hayden just S of Costco and N of Raintree Rd on the East side of the road. The parking lot is a little scary but there is a decent amount of parking. I called and ordered Pho soup for pickup and they said it would be ready 5-10 mins. When I arrived it was being wrapped up in the back. The man at the desk was very nice. They do delivery through a delivery company but they charge by distance I believe. The inside was very cute. The pictures make it look a lot fancier than it is, but most Vietnamese places are hole in the walls, so this was definitely a step up from that.  When I got the soup home it was still warm. Not hot or cold which was great. I added everything into the broth and the basil aroma just filled my kitchen. They did include a fork, spoon and chop sticks which was great. The flavors were all there but it definitely could have had some more basil, noodles and sprouts personally. I don't hold this against them though because delivery is always a little different than on location. I will definitely be returning! The price was great and the menu had plenty to chose from! They have been around since 2005 and definitely deserve to stay around!!
Excellent chicken Pho!  Vegetarian spring rolls were also very tasty.  I will definitely be coming back here..conveniently located in the Scottsdale airpark.

Ok let me explain this five star.   First off this won't be long. The food was hands down best Vietnamese food in town! Heard amazing things and when me and my girlfriend showed up for dinner we were equally satisfied when we left. My girlfriend got the fried tofu and spring roll noodle and I got the grilled pork and egg roll noodle. With the fresh lettuce, cucumber, peanuts,fish sauce, herbs, and a very well made rice noodle, hands down new favorite spot to eat.  Ok now second off. Not very nice people to be around. Very direct with no smiling what so ever. We literally couldn't even give them a compliment without them blowing us off. But hey I'm a chef and I only count the food these days cause you can't always find good service! Seriously been there two days ago and told everyone I know

I stayed in north Phoenix and didn't want to drive to Chandler for Pho so I found Saigon Nites on Yelp. Being from So Cal and having so many choices I was reluctant going to have Pho in Scottsdale but it was convenient.   I ordered the special Pho with beef, tripe, meat balls and tendon. The bowl was $7.99 and the flavor was decent but I guess I'm spoiled with Pho from San Gabriel and Westminster. I did notice that the meat balls were soft and not firm like the ones I usually eat. The bowl was a decent size and satisfied my soup craving for the evening.   Saigon Nites accepts Visa and MasterCard with a minimum of $7.50

Ehhhhhh....when I walked in..it smelt like a mix of a sewer smell and pho...red flag. I ordered steak and meatball pho...and the noodles were so hard! Broth was whatever...overall I think it could of been cleaner..I had to look at all my spoons and little dish to see if they were dirty..which yes they were...won't be coming back. The meat also was way too thick and dry.

I've been dreaming about Saigon Nites ever since I went there some weeks ago.  hmm, what do you feel like?  Saigon Nites I chime!    We shared fried shrimp wontons, they were 'eh', I probably wouldn't get them again. Shrimp Pho, simple and mild, yet tasty! Saigon Nites Walnut Shrimp, OMG!  I thoroughly enjoyed this.  It's a little...different.  It's pretty sweet, so sharing is a good idea.  Mmmmm, YUM!!!

Bad service!   Rude little man running the front.  First, he took our order without writing anything down.  Took 30 min to get one dish, and it was the wrong dish.  The guy never apologized, only to come back to snap at me, telling me I gave him the wrong item?  Wtf?! Don't you think I know what I ordered?  I was polite and said it's ok, bring me my correct order.  He yells saying it will take 25 min.  That's fine, but wtf are you yelling at your customer over your mistake! ? I politely said that's fine, I'll wait.  Other costumers saw and I know they see how rude he was.    So 2 min later, he came back with his attitude to remind me 25 min! Like he wanted to start something.  I heard him the first time and said it's ok, I'll wait!  After that, we got up and left.    Don't be a waiter or run a business if you can't smile or have some decent customer service!  It was his mistake and he took it out on me.  Go back to bed. Rude, rude, rude

I just tried this place based on the reviews on here but I was disappointed. No ambiance, though that's not always a bad thing. The staff was courteous but the food left lots to be desired. The spring rolls,  which I always look forward to at Vietnamese restaurants, were wimpy. The pho was ok,  nothing special. I had to ask for cilantro on the side. I'd come here again if I was really craving pho and didn't have time to go anywhere else.

Not quite sure as to why the Pho has gotten mixed reviews as it is consistently tasty and authentic. I've been there numerous times and generally get good service as well. I've had my fair share of vietnamese food, and this is definitely some of the better I've had. I'd recommend it.

Ok,  Not great, but ok.  Hey it's Scottsdale not the Bay Area.  Prices are not bad for Scottsdale $8.99 for pho, 4.99 for Goi Cuon,  portions are medium or small in a hard core Pho shop.  But, Once again it's Scottsdale.  I would eat here before I drove 15 miles to the closest other place.  I'm a fan of pho "pronounced fu as in fun"  Goi Cuon had decent flavor with mint, lettuce, rice noodles, pork and shrimp.  Peanut sauce was so so but spice it up with hoisin and shriracha.  Had the combination pho.  had soft tendon, tripe, meatballs, fatty brisket, rare beef.  It was acceptable.  As other review stated only got 1 piece of lime and no Jalapenos.  I did not ask for more just used the hot sauce.  broth was acceptable,  it could be a lot better but it was sufficient.  Not a lot of anise flavor I'm used to.  All and all I would eat there again if I'm near the place.  Would not drive far just to eat there.

First time visiting the restaurant as I am always looking for a good place to have Pho, my all time favorite food.  :)  Ordered the Steak Pho and Spring Rolls.  The spring rolls were fresh.  The pho broth was seasoned well.  I ordered extra noodles because another Yelp review said you would need it, but I definitely did not.  Ended up being almost like a bowl of pasta and not what I like with pho as one of the best parts should be the broth, but I don't blame the owner at all as that is what I ordered.  Best pho I have found in Scottsdale, though UnPHOgettable in Mesa remains my favorite.

Came here with 3 others just before closing on a weeknight (8:00pm).   They graciously waited as we were slow in deciding what to order. So since some in my posse weren't sure, I got the appetizers going.  I ordered 3 orders of Goi Cuon (Spring Rolls with shrimp and veggies in rice paper), 2 with peanut sauce, and for the one who as allergic to peanuts, with Nuoc Mam (sweet fish sauce). They were nicely rolled and delicious.  I also ordered Banh Xeo (large fried crepe/omelete stuffed with sprouts, veggies, shrimp and pork strips). This was a new experience for my 3 friends, but they all loved it. You slice out a piece, then stuff it into lettuce, add veggies, and dip into Nuoc Mam again and eat. Yummy! They were a little light on the veggies, though, and served it with Cilantro, which is OK, but I like some mint leaves mixed in, too. And the lettuce they first brought out was Iceberg. The second round they switched to Romaine, which is more typical.   The group was happy with the appetizers, and again with their main as they all ordered what they were seeking. One, Lemongrass Chicken with rice; another the Dac Biet (special) Pho with all variations of beef, another, the Bun (vermicelli) rice noodle plate with pork; and me, I asked for Pho Tai Nam (rare rib eye and cooked flank beef noodle soup).  We had 33 Brand beers (Vietnamese) and enjoyed the good company and good food. We closed the place down, and the owners have small kids, so they were very sweet and understanding, and patient with us. We also chatted for awhile. The wife is from south of old Saigon, and the husband is from the beautiful central beach resort of Nha Trang.   Best Vietnamese in the Valley that I know of!

Pretty good. Pho was exceptional! Also had the spring rolls very good. Pad Thai which was ok. Lemon chicken which was good and sweet and sour soup very different but good. Sweet and sour soup would also be good with chicken instead of shrimp. I will definitely go back for the pho.
chicken pho and veggie spring rolls? oh, yeah baby

Well it was open! That made a decision for us to go there vs. nearing Indian restaurant. And guess what - it was totally worth it. Yeah ice tea suxed, do not order that. But rolls were awesome, as was peanut sauce they came with. Other two dishes we got were pretty good too, can not recall what it was.  Service was good without being too annoying or non-present. Place seemed to be constantly busy with slow/steady flow of walk-ins and orders.  All in all, it was pretty good lunch.  "I like"  Eugene

Worst PHO I have ever eaten in my life. I live in Los Angeles and have eaten at many pho places across the county and state. This is hand down the worst pho ever. The soup base was unlike anything ANY of us in my 8 person party had ever eaten. It reminded me of a watered down  frozen won ton soup base.   Not much meat and the noodles were strange,  like something you would buy in bulk for a major discount at a ran down Asian Market.   The service was horrific! The woman was actually getting mad and arguing with all of us. None of us have ever NOT Left a tip in our lives until this dining experience. Absolutely dumb found by the service.  I do understand why some people left good reviews considering this is Arizona and most people would have no idea how really good pho should taste.   DON'T GO HERE!!!

I'm always looking for good Pho so I tried here. The atmosphere was a little hectic as there were a couple small children running around like crazy. Not sure if they were related to the staff or not. I got calamari which looked and tasted like the basic frozen rings you can get anywhere. The broth of My Pho was decent but the noodles were very chewy. I had to bite through them with my teeth. Overall not impressed. Hopefully it was just a bad day.

great vietnamese noodle here in scottsdale. if you don't want to drive to camelback (other pho place). this place will satisfy your craving for pho. they don't have much of other vietnamese food, I think because in this area they don't have much of vietnamese. so if you just want pho, this place will do. if you want other vietnamese food. you have to go to other vietnamese restaurant.

First time ordering food here, despite having SN bookmarked for years.  Ordered takeout, since delivery charges proved to be too much*, even for someone who is trying to speedily recuperate from a nasty cold (that's me), especially now that I know how short a drive it is for a pickup... I can use the $10+ savings for another bowl of pho, or entree!  Estimated time for pickup (20-25 minutes) was accurate, or at least it was for this trip.  I ordered the Crispy Calamari ($8; buttermilk batter, pickled cucumbers and carrots on the side, and side of sweet chili sauce), Special Pho ($9; thin-sliced steak, well-done flank, tripe, and meatballs, with egg noodles, instead of rice noodles, +$1), and Shaken Beef ($10; stir-fried with green beans, onions, and bell peppers and came with a side of white rice, and I added extra side of egg noodles, +$1).  I enjoyed everything!  Their pho broth is slightly sweet, but this can be off-set by adding slices of jalape√±os.  The thin slices of raw steak were packed with the egg noodles, bean sprouts, cilantro, jalape√±os, and mint.**  I divided these steak slices into two bowls, poured the broth and other meats on top, and then we added the garnishes.  I didn't care for the well-done flank, and Mom told me not to add any lime, because she didn't like how her soup tasted with it; Mom wanted the Special, for the meatballs and tripe, so we went with that, instead of my ordering the Steak pho.  In the end, she didn't care for the pho... She's still stuck on her Bun Bo Hue (at Mekong Plaza)!  She also didn't care for the Crispy Calamari, but I found them to be tasty, even without dipping in the sweet chili sauce.  I liked the crispiness of the battered coating, despite the app being ensconced in its styrofoam box from the time of pickup, my quick detour to the post office, and finally home, where the goods were released from their non-biodegradeable cages as soon as they hit the table.  If these calamari rings were French fries, they would've been too soggy to eat in that short span of time, but they weren't.  Lastly, the Shaken Beef was as delicious as I imagined they would be!  Well, almost-- I didn't expect it to have a sweet component (prob from the onions and bell peppers), but the peppery meatiness, as well as the crisped stir-fried green beans- I try not to eat inflammatory bell peppers and leave them where they lie- made it a pleasurable meal.  I really enjoyed eating this dish with the extra egg noodles.  We probably won't order the calamari again, but I wouldn't mind trying other items on the menu!  I also noticed that SN offers milk teas (with boba, if you want), as well as Thai iced tea, but I will have to wait until I beat this nasty cold virus before taxing my system with unnecessary added sugars!  Oh, and btw, Visa and Mastercard only, with a $7.50 minimum purchase.  * $6 delivery charge, plus a 15% service fee.  The delivery is handled by a third party, Eat24, which takes your online order and relays it to the business in question, in this case SN.    **  Be sure to place your takeout bags on the floor of the car, in a space where they can't move around too much, to prevent spillage!  I had them on the floor, but with a lot of room to move.  Thankfully, the kitchen packed the soup and Shaken Beef styro containers in their own plastic bags, which still allowed them to spill over their containers, but not all over my car floor- whew!

In North Scottsdale, it can be hard to find authentic independently owned restaurants that won't cost you an arm and a leg.  Saigon is one of those rare gems where you can get decent Vietnamese for a fairly decent price.  Their menu though, seems to be a hybrid of Vietnamese with other types of Asian cuisine.  We ordered a few dishes to go, and some dishes were definitely better (and more Vietnamese tasting) than others.  The best entrees we had were probably the papaya salad and the vermicelli noodles- both very fresh tasting and flavorful.  The scallops in black bean sauce were more of a Chinese style dish, and the scallops themselves were a little tough, served with an anemic amount of veggies (just green pepper).  The lemongrass chicken was good, but my favorite lemongrass chicken so far is at Khai Hoan, where it is more saturated with flavor.  If I am in the area again and am craving Vietnamese food, I'll probably head over and try some more of their Vietnamese dishes.
Found this restaurant on yelp. We stopped by on the way to the airport. The two items we ordered were excellent, equivalent to the good Vietnamese restaurant in the bay area. Highly recommended!

Really good PHO and wonderful service. Came for lunch with my hubby and parking is crazy. It gets busy during lunch so would suggest going early or later towards the end of the lunch hour.  Food is excellent.  started off with the Sampler and it's perfect for 2 people.  I had the beef Pho and my hubby had the Special Pho (it has meat, meatballs, tribe, and other stuff). Broth is soooo good that's what made it delicious. If your not the type of person to add extra spices in the broth then totally okay. It's great by itself.  Too bad it's a far drive from my house or I would be here on a weekly basis.

This is by far my most favorite place to get Pho in the valley! I've had pho from 20-or-so places in the valley and they have the best!  The owner and her husband are very nice and always welcoming. The food is always fresh and tasty. I normally get the summer rolls and chicken pho.   It's probably too much that they know my exact order when I come in and are puzzled when I decide something different. I've had many things on the menu and never had anything that wasn't good.   If you go, definitely the summer rolls, pho, salt and pepper shrimp (so good!!) or shaken beef.   I could go on and on about how much I love their food. The place is always clean.  About anyone questioning delivery... They don't deliver directly. A delivery service that you call and place you order with will deliver and charge a fee. They are a small business in the middle of a business park, I can understand why they can't have staff to deliver.

One of my favorite dishes in pho. Chicken pho. And the chicken pho here is unbelievable.  The broth is so flavorful and savory; I could eat it all by itself without the noodles or anything.  But, the noodles are delicious too so I am glad that they are in the stock.  I don't even add any sriracha or hoisen sauce or anything because the soup is perfect as it is. And I love that this place is in a little strip mall and owned by a local family.

We have been coming here for as long as they are in business, 10+ years?  Pho has been very consistent with its quality and taste.  Broth is authentic and always well seasoned.  Our favorite items, other than Pho, are spring rolls, egg rolls, vermicelli and chicken wings.  Basically, Saigon Nites is a Pho restaurant, so many of the items on the items are a bit average.  We come here specifically for Pho which is difficult to find in Scottsdale.  This is a family owned restaurant, it is very cozy, clean and friendly.  The husband-and-wife owners do a great job in maintaining good quality food.  Saigon Nites is my family's go-to take-out place and still enjoy their cooking.  We love to support our local business!
Great food. Great service. The atmosphere is nothing out of this world, but the restaurant looks and feels clean. This is one of the best places to go for authentic Vietnamese food.

I've thought about this before writing this because of being a small business owners and understanding that maybe the owners and staff just had a bad day.  I didn't want to write this because everyone is entitled to their own opinion of services and food and didn't want to damage another business reputation with just my opinion. So here it goes. My son and I go here to eat all the time because it's convenient instead of having to drive all the way out to Phoenix or Mesa for really good Pho.  It's good, not great by any means but could be great if you just don't know anything about Pho.  However, the service here is the worst I've ever experienced.  I know that Pho places really aren't known for service but this place is just rude.  Try Unphogettable in Mesa so you can see what good food and service is about and you will know what I mean about rude here. I've just always put up with it because it's just typical of Pho restaurants.  So, headed back to work, my friend asked me to pick up an order to go for her.  After waiting for about 20 minutes after we were done eating for the to go order even though we placed the order when we ordered our other food too, the order came back wrong.  I told the pregnant owner what our correct order was.  She placed the order by the registered and left us there hanging.  After another 20 minutes, I asked for the order again.  She said they are too busy and have decided not to correct the order.  I asked her why she didn't tell me and would just make me sit there and wait.  No answer other than that she is too busy to deal with it.  So, I pay and put under the tip line none because poor service.  Actually wrote that in so that they won't write in their tips, which they have done once before on me.  I reconciled my statement over the weekend and pull out my receipt.  Apparently, I have now also been charged the to go order even though I didn't take it.  Called and she answered and argues with me that I took the order.  This is ridiculous.  We are not some scam artist or willing to lie over some $9 order.  Tried to explain to her that we did not but she just hung up the phone on me.  Wow!!  Talk about hormonal...

I'm gluten free.  Love the Pho and my favorite is the rice crepe! awesome.  If only the produce were a bit more local/organic - they would really be perfect.   Small place, fast service, packed for lunch.
I eat pho twice a week. I'm a huge fan. This place is my go to in Scottsdale. Great prices, service, and food. The pho is remarkably flavorful. Definitely come here!

The steak pho is the best pho I've ever experienced. The shrimp one is also good. The spring rolls are my favorite because the peanut sauce is very tasty. You get 4 spring rolls in one order. The eggplant is also very delightful I love to order it with light oil. It comes with about eight triangle pieces of fried tofu. I love this place.

Ideal for lunches, a casual fast service, seat yourself Vietnamese restaurant. The spring rolls were pretty tasty. Not fresh, I could tell the wrappers were a little chewy, but the peanut sauce was tasty. The pho was good but not great. The meatballs were hearty and I liked the ample helping of green onions, but the steak was pretty dry and the broth was watered down and sorely in need of spice.   Tip: the pho is better than second day if you put the jalapeno slices they give you in the broth and let it marinate overnight

Absolutely awesome. This is one of my regular places. Always consistently good with friendly, smiling staff. Family owned and run, one cannot ask for a more friendly place with outstanding food.   I have been frequenting Saigon Nites on a regular basis for at least two years and have never been disappointed with the food or the service. And it is consistent regardless of the day of the week or the time of day.   Note: closed on Sundays.

I'm from San Jose/San Francisco and there are viet restaurants everywhere and competition is fierce. Saigon Nites has decent pho but could be better. Broth is a little lacking and is a little too salty. Portions are small compared to the "regular" bowl sizes I'm use to in San Jose/San Francisco especially for the price. It's typically $8/9 for a large bowl in CA and it's loaded to the brim with noodles and meat. Saigon Nites is the 2nd pho restaurant I've visited in Phoenix while on biz. The other pho restaurant that I visited in December (which will remain nameless) had the most flavorless broth I ever tasted. The "other" pho place regular was $8.50 and was the size of what I consider a San Jose/San Francisco small/child sized bowl and had half a meat ball and 4 slices of steak. Given the circumstances of the town I'm visiting I say Saigon Nites is definitely the best in this town and rate them a 3.5 to 4 star.

I really like Vietnamese food and we wanted to try a new place. So Saigon Nites was the place. This is a very unassuming place. In a strip mall that has a gas station next to it. So as I saw it my expectations wasn't very high.   Walking in I was very surprised that the place is bigger than it looks from the outside. Decent amount of tables and it's basically a seat yourself type of place. We found our table and was greeted right away with water cups coming right after.   So we ordered the spring rolls which comes with four fairly large pieces. Rolls were very fresh and really liked the peanut dipping sauce. I know there was shrimp in the rolls but very limited. So rolls were good.  It wasn't the best I've had but I liked it a lot.   I had the lemon grass chicken. It had thinly sliced chicken with onions in a bed of lemon grass and a side of white rice. The dish had a nice kick to it. I enjoyed it a lot and it didn't disappoint.   My wife decided to have the Beef Meatball Pho. Huge bowl. Larger than most bowls that I've been too. Didn't hear any complaints and she really did like it a lot  My daughter got the pork and egg roll vermicelli noodle bowl. Huge bowl again. More than most places but she did notice that there wasn't as much vermicelli noodles but a little more bean sprouts which was fine. She didn't complain but really enjoyed her bowl. The serving for the Pho and Vermicelli bowls were so big that my wife and daughter had leftovers and happy they had some leftovers to take home.   So the one thing I noticed at this place is the place must be some mom and pop shop. All the servers we're Vietnamese and male. So it was basically find your seat, take your order and enjoy. Not a lot friendly service but efficient service. Older man was always filling out water glasses and food did come out of the kitchen fairly quickly. I personally think a few women working up front would make this place a little more friendly but hey they have really good food so I'm not complaining. Just an observation.   I really did like this place and can't wait to try some of their other items on the menu. Enjoy. We sure did.

Got a call from a friend today asking for a Vietnamese food recommendation in Phoenix .. and of course the answer was Saigon Nites.  AMAZINGLY friendly family owned business.  We go down to the desert every summer and we drive straight here from PHX.  Better than almost all of the Vietnamese SF places and definitely on par with So Cal.  Highly recommend the Banh Xeo - crepe and the soup stock is excellent.  Just had to yelp-it because I'm craving Vietnamese food and glad to see all the photos !  Oh and it's pretty cheap - usually under $25 for both of us
My go to pho spot!! I hate that they close so early but its okay. I still love the food here!!
We ordered to go and decided to just dine in when we got there, the midget guy said we can't because it's a hassle for them, that's so lame, i'm never gettig food here ever again

This is my go to Vietnamese place on the North side of Phoenix metro. The food is very good and they will custom make things upon request. The prices are more than fair and the staff accommodating and friendly! This is a winner! If you like shrimp this is the place it's always huge and fresh!

This is my family go to Vietnamese place. A nice family business. The quality of food is pretty consistent over the years. My son always has the same pho and the owner knows it by heart. We like the pho most, whether they are beef, beef ball or special. We like the calamari and the egg roll for appetizers . The vermicelli noodles are good too. The restaurant has been there for over 10 years (or at least close to) and hopefully will still be there many years.

I've been here twice.  Prices are okay... I like my Vietnamese on the less expensive side, but we are up in N. S'dale so the location probably adds to the tab.  Anyhow... went with my husband the first time... had a fantastic dish with chicken and shrimp in a brown sauce with pan fried noodle squares...wish I had taken a picture... but wow... yum and a textural experience you can't really describe, okay, maybe someone could describe it but I'm tired tonight and I don't want to get into it.  Told my sister about it... we went there... she also yelped on the same matter... Pho was warm, almost luke-warm when we got it.  Basil didn't wilt in the soup.  Not a good thing at all.  Service was slow, but as expected as it's family owned and the place was full. There is somewhat of a language barrier with ordering...  for the most part...MOST of the order came out right... but we had to ask for alot of things that should've just been done already.  So, I have to give this place 3 stars.. 1st time there..PHO was hot.  2nd time there PHO was not.  I would still def plan on going back there... but's it's not my first preference of Vietnamese in the valley.  I do however hope good success to this restaurant, I think if they got things tuned in right... this place could be a hit in North Scottsdale.

Did online order, ordered extra noodles and beef to satisfy delivery requirements, what was delivered was about average.  Food was good, but had to pay 2X for normal amount just to get it delivered.  Will not order again.

Chicken wings for starters - love it.  I had the special pho (beef, tripe, meatball) - pretty good.  Hubby ordered shaken beef - also good.  Service was great as well. It's nearby so we definitely found our new go-to place for pho.

FOOD: This place has really tasty pho and bun. I am surprised at the quality of food considering its one of the only Vietnamese restaurants in Scottsdale. The portions are very large and the price is very decent as well. I will be coming back most definitely. SERVICE: Considering its an Asian restaurant, you can't expect a lot of service so I did take off 1 star for that. Other than that, food is good and service isn't that great but not the worst either. Although no one came to check on us... And we were the only table in the restaurant at 3:00pm.  ENVIRONMENT: Pretty clean and they played a lot of backstreet boys music...I can hear them talking in the kitchen the whole time in Vietnamese but that doesn't bother me.
When it comes to Vietnamese food. I'm definitely a pho lover. I have to say after going to this restaurant. Their food was un-pho-gettable!

Reasonably priced and pretty tasty. The restaurant is nothing much to look at and it's in an odd little spot tucked into the industrial/commercial park near the scottsdale airpark, but the food is good, plentiful, and service is fast. Convenient for take out as well. Had their beef/meatball and special pho so far.

This place was very good, its always hard to find a good Vietnamese restraunt that has a decent amount of dishes on the menu. We went in around 2:30 and there was no one there so we were served very quickly, and the gentleman waiting on us was very patient with my mother and all her questions and indecisiveness (Is that even a word?). The pho was a good size and there were plenty of vegetables on the side. I loved how they give a nice amount of cilantro in the broth too. The chicken curry was also very good. The next time I visit Phoenix I will definitely come back.

They are Super Slow. It took them 25 minutes to serve my spring rolls and it took them 35 minutes to serve two Pho. The taste was average. The soup base was too sweat. The bean sprouts are Not fresh at all. Won't come back.

The food here was about a 2.5 but the service was a solid zero. We showed up around 7:20 and we're greeted by "we close at 8".  Ok, we're both getting the P2 and will easily be out by 8. Seems completely acceptable to us, but immediately after we sat down we realized we definitely upset them by deciding we wanted to eat there. We were handed our waters, food and bill all at about the same time. At 7:30 the restaurant shut off the music and we could hear them talking about us quite loudly in the back (in English) which made for one of the most awkward restaurant experiences ever. The employees here clearly don't give a Pho about their customers, which is sad. We've definitely never felt so uncomfortable and rushed  in a restaurant. If you don't want to seat people after 7pm, please just tell them that. I would have much rather heard "we already closed our kitchen" versus heating workers talk badly about me and being rushed out.

This is the best pho place in scottsdale. Chicken Pho and their meatball/brisket pho - amazingly good. I also love their fresh spring rolls. The restaurant is clean and the service is impeccable. Very reasonable price if you live in scottsdale.

I have been dining at Saigon Nites for years, and it has consistently high-quality food with authentic preparations and consistently average service. Tonight, the floor is incredibly sticky as I walk through the restaurant. They have a lovely new paint job but need a good steam cleaning of the floors. Service was prompt, and friendly. The restaurant was not busy, with three or four tables occupied. I ordered the lemongrass chicken, and forgot that I normally have them add broccoli. This dish is pretty much just chicken and onions over lettuce, and it benefits greatly from a green vegetable. The flavors are fantastic, but the presentation is very plain. Dining companion ordered egg noodle soup, and was very pleased. The soup always has a good portion of chicken and shrimp in it along with a couple of fish balls. All soups here are excellent, the shrimp wonton is especially yummy. The family that owns Saigon nites is very sweet and we have watched their children grow up. Tonight we had the pleasure of the 13 year old son bringing our check. My other favorite meal is the chicken vermicelli bowl with grilled dark meat chicken lettuce herbs bean sprouts and rice noodles.  Sounds like it's time for another trip to Saigon nites!

Just ate here a couple times in the past 2 weeks. Love it. Great Pho. I also had the vermicelli pork BBQ bowl. It was really good as well. The tender and not to fatty. Great quality, good service and good prices.
Yum yum yum. SO fresh vegetables. I loved this place SO much. Good price, huge servings, high quality fresh food well cooked. Awesome. I'll be back
This is my favorite lunch spot in AZ...I don't care if its a 115 outside i still go in and dominate the pho...its the best pho i've had and the staff is great!

Hands-down the best Pho in all of Arizona! Traditional Vietnamese music sets the atmosphere with fast service and amazing food! Super kind and considerate staff, hoping one day they create a Vegan Pho with brown rice noodles! A must-eat of Arizona for sure!
Best place to get Pho! Their fried rice is also super good! This is the only place I will go to get Pho. The staff is also always very nice

Called in to place my take out order - fresh spring rolls, bbq pork banh mi and meatball pho. I was very excited to try the spring rolls however, it was the biggest disappointment. Ive never seen such skinny looking spring rolls before. Huge disappointment. The peanut sauce that comes with it wasn't that special either. The banh mi was too salty. The bread was good but not great. The broth of the pho was pretty good though.   Indoor seating only. Tons of parking right outside.

If you're in the area, this will be the best place to get tasty pho. I honestly haven't tried anything other than the pho because it's that delicious. The service is great considering they only have about two servers taking care of everything. They have boba as well which is always a plus. I come here about 5 or more times a month since I work close. Love this place!

Busy industrial area.  Parking lot is very old but not their fault.  Doesn't look so fancy outside.  But the restaurant is clean.  Very important.  I did not use the bathroom so I cannot comment on that :).  A bowl of pho chicken was $7.50.  Great price for north Scottsdale, or anywhere.  Other places are about $10.  The broth is clean and flavorful.  I would always add hoisin sauce and sriracha.  But after tasting their broth, I have decided to stop diluting the broth by adding sauces.  Kind of like killing a great steak by adding A1 sauce.  if you want, just put the sauces on the side and dip your meat in it, don't kill the broth.  I would def go back.  It is only 10 mins from work.
It's average pho if your a pho addict. Standard Asian service--little talk and you get your food. Summer rolls were average too. Only thing I'll really knock is the bathroom was dirty.

Good pho restaurant! Friendly service, clean facility and good tasting broth. Came in on a Thursday afternoon and it was really quiet. Ordered pho, spring rolls, egg rolls and combination pork chop dish. The rice dishes were good and hearty. Great value for your $$$. The soup had a tasty broth, but wasn't hearty enough. I would order a side of noodles to fill you up. The tea is steeped inside the tea cup so drink it quickly if you don't like your your tea dark. Overall good spot and will be back on our next visit to Scottsdale.

I happen to be nearby so I thought I would give Saigon  Nites a visit. It's probably been over three years since I had lunch there. I remember it being a fairly good place to have lunch.  I had pretty decent pho there and grilled salmon before. This time I had the crispy chicken wings for an appetizer. They were very good. They had a good crust on them, very crunchy and not oily at all.  I also ordered the Banh Xeo which is a Vietnamese Rice cr√™pe because I had one at a Vietnamese restaurant in Glendale and absolutely loved it. I was disappointed with this one. It was very mushy on the inside and not very flavorful.  I discovered it was from over cooked saut√©ed onions.The shrimp and pork could have been a little more fresh in my opinion. The pork was his specially dried out and did not have much flavor.  The top of the cr√™pe was crunchy and actually pretty good.  It came with fresh lettuce, meant, cilantro and cucumbers that came with the crepe.  I won't be ordering this again.  I have to say that I do prefer the Vietnamese restaurants on the west side and in Glendale. However, this is not a bad option if you are in the area and want Vietnamese food. I had no problem with the service and it does have a nice atmosphere.

Vietnamese crepe-huge and delicious Vietnamese pad Thai- unique and delicious Saigon nites shrimp fried rice- perfect Beef vermicelli (dry)- tasted great  Thai iced tea- homemade and not from a can Calamari appetizer- perfectly made Service- professional and friendly

After returning from Asian food mecca (the golden coast) my sister found herself with a hankering for some Thai iced tea with boba.  Research led us to Saigon Nites, and they did not disappoint! In fact, she got a refill, and if anyone's had a Thai iced tea before... that's some serious biznis in the form of condensed milk. Add boba, and you're at about a 1,000 calories, but, like a true warrior, she downed 'em both.  We also had the green papaya salad with shrimp and an order of fried rice, and neither was particularly impressive. The sauce/spices/flavor on both were pretty bland, and the shrimp didn't seem all that fresh. On the plus side, the fried rice came in an ogre portion size, so if you're looking for value, this dish will leave you with leftovers for days.  It may be a sit-down restaurant, but in future, we'll be gettin' boba tea to-go.
I had a shrimp wonton soup noodles, the soup is OK but the wonton is horrible. And I was really thirsty after, I bet they put a lot MSG in the soup.

Sad to learn that there are only 2 Pho places near the office... North Scottsdale developers are you listening? Enough of the chains! Enough of the fast food! Enough of the same old same old!  But I digress...  It was a small, clean comfortable restaurant situated next to a carwash. Now that I know where it is - I won't forget ;0)  The employees are very fast, friendly and helpful. We were promptly seated, given water within a couple of minutes and our water was back to get our order quickly.  Two of us got the Pho (one meatball, one steak) and the other in our party got the lemongrass chicken.   I'm relatively new to the Pho craze, but I have to say this is by far the best I've had. And it was all in the broth. So full of flavor you could literally taste the hours and hours of work put into it. The steak was perfect!! My colleague wasn't crazy about her meatballs and vowed to try the steak next time.   The three of us split an order of the spring rolls which were amazing.   I can't say enough about the broth - like crust on a pizza - the broth makes or breaks the Pho.   We will DEFINITELY be back!
great place to go for a lunch bowl of pho! always love coming here
Best pho in the valley! Fast service. Ever since moving from California to here, (California had the best pho) and Saigon Nites is just as good.

** Review for PHO  I had their steak Pho and was immediately greeted by a plate of wilted basil, wilted bean sprouts, 1 little lime and no jalapenos.  Not a good start.  The Pho itself was "ok" but nothing special.  The meat was very sparse and very small pieces and the Pho portion in it's entirety was pretty small for the $7 price tag.  The broth was, again, just "ok" and didn't stand out as "awesome" or "great".
Awesome food great prices. The Vietnamese curry dishes one of the best I've ever had. anyone that left less than five stars is insane.
Everything was average.  Fairly clean place.  Banh Xeo had to much bean sprouts.  The proportion of veg to meat was off.
Terrible. I have no clue how this place has 4 stars. The food was over cooked, pad thai was the worst I have ever had and the service is awful. I will never go back to this establishment.

The pho was so so,  but nowhere good as the pho in Tempe, Chandler, Mesa, and Phoenix. A dollar or two more expensive than I'd really like.  Also my friend ordered the combo pho and I ordered the beef and brisket pho w/ the large size upgrade and when they came out they were the same size.  They ended up costing about the same.  The server said the combo always comes in the larger sized bowl,  but why wasn't there any mention of this in the menu?  Felt slightly cheated. It was very clean inside though a rare thing in the five places I like to get my pho though.
Great place! Great lunch specials. I pretty much rotate between the sandwiches, pho and vermicelli noodles. The best spring rolls! Great people too.

You'll find good food, clean dining room, and fast service here. I've tried their rice plates, noodle soups, noodle salads and several appetizers and all were equally delicious and consistently. They also offer boba/smoothie drinks as well.

Saigon Nites is our favorite Vietnamese cuisine in Scottsdale. The authentic Pho, spring rolls, and chicken fried rice (for the kids) is our go-to-order every time!  The yelp app makes it easy to re-order for delivery each time!

Let's just say that this place is great for a quick bowl, they have lunch specials from 11-3 all under $8.99 I got the special pho with a mixture of meats, added all the jalape√±os and more spices and it was by far the best pho I've had, the service was great, everyone was attentive and so nice. Great customer service and great food.

I go here because it's close to my work but it would not be my go-to pho place if I had a choice.  The service is friendly, but I don't like that the owner keeps her baby at the restaurant and cries in the back kitchen area.  I get it, she doesn't have daycare, but then stay at home with the baby - her husband is already there and they have a staff that can man the place while she's taking care of her baby properly at home.  An infant or any child does not belong in a restaurant kitchen all day long.   Moving on to the food - I'm not a vegetarian but the person I frequent this place with, loves their vegetarian spring rolls.  I'm actually pleasantly surprised by how tasty it is.  The rice paper is chewy and the veggies are fresh.  I always order pho but not something on the menu - it's called pho tai gan sach.  Basically pho with rare beef and tripe.  Their pho there is tasty but never enough noodles and way too much broth - I guess they do that on purpose as you can order extra pho noodles for an extra fee.    Again, I'd eat here because it's decent and their wait staff is friendly and the food comes out fast.
I think I found my new favorite lunch spot. The Pho is very good and service was fast.

Place kind of smells like body odor, must be the spices and aromas from the kitchen. The debit card minimum is 7.50 which forced me to go to the gas station next door to to buy something and get cash back just for some boba. Boba tastes good so ill give three stars.

Ingredients are always super fresh which is something I really appreciate in a Pho soup. They are always really busy so I order a lot for pick up during lunch. What I love is that they give you an awesome quantity of soup, rice noodle, veggies and soup condiments even on the go which most places skimp on that when your not eating in but no this place. I do recommend ordering before hand if your getting your food to go because they get very busy

This restaurant is located in a shopping plaza with ample parking. There's probably 15 tables at the most as the space is somewhat small. So it tends to get crowded during lunch hour. I'm a Pho addict and will order nothing but that, except for the occasional spring rolls. I have tried their steak Pho a couple of times and seem to find them in the middle of the pack with regards to taste and flavor. I've had better and worse.
